org.deeplearning4j.spark.util.data

Class SparkDataValidation

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.deeplearning4j.spark.util.data.SparkDataValidation

  • public class SparkDataValidation
extends java.lang.Object
    Utilities for validating DataSets and MultiDataSets saved (usually) in a HDFS directory.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static ValidationResult deleteInvalidDataSets(org.apache.spark.api.java.JavaSparkContext sc, java.lang.String path)
      Validate DataSet objects - and delete any invalid DataSets - that have been previously saved to the specified directory on HDFS by attempting to load them and checking their contents.

    • Method Detail

      • validateDataSets

        public static ValidationResult validateDataSets(org.apache.spark.api.java.JavaSparkContext sc,
                                                java.lang.String path)
        Validate DataSet objects saved to the specified directory on HDFS by attempting to load them and checking their contents. Assumes DataSets were saved using DataSet.save(OutputStream).
        Note: this method will also consider all files in subdirectories (i.e., is recursive).
        Parameters:
        sc - Spark context
        path - HDFS path of the directory containing the saved DataSet objects
        Returns:
        Results of the validation

      • validateDataSets

        public static ValidationResult validateDataSets(org.apache.spark.api.java.JavaSparkContext sc,
                                                java.lang.String path,
                                                int[] featuresShape,
                                                int[] labelsShape)
        Validate DataSet objects saved to the specified directory on HDFS by attempting to load them and checking their contents. Assumes DataSets were saved using DataSet.save(OutputStream).
        This method (optionally) additionally validates the arrays using the specified shapes for the features and labels. Note: this method will also consider all files in subdirectories (i.e., is recursive).
        Parameters:
        sc - Spark context
        path - HDFS path of the directory containing the saved DataSet objects
        featuresShape - May be null. If non-null: feature arrays must match the specified shape, for all values with shape > 0. For example, if featuresShape = {-1,10} then the features must be rank 2, can have any size for the first dimension, but must have size 10 for the second dimension.
        labelsShape - As per featuresShape, but for the labels instead
        Returns:
        Results of the validation

      • deleteInvalidDataSets

        public static ValidationResult deleteInvalidDataSets(org.apache.spark.api.java.JavaSparkContext sc,
                                                     java.lang.String path)
        Validate DataSet objects - and delete any invalid DataSets - that have been previously saved to the specified directory on HDFS by attempting to load them and checking their contents. Assumes DataSets were saved using DataSet.save(OutputStream).
        Note: this method will also consider all files in subdirectories (i.e., is recursive).
        Parameters:
        sc - Spark context
        path - HDFS path of the directory containing the saved DataSet objects
        Returns:
        Results of the validation/deletion

      • deleteInvalidDataSets

        public static ValidationResult deleteInvalidDataSets(org.apache.spark.api.java.JavaSparkContext sc,
                                                     java.lang.String path,
                                                     int[] featuresShape,
                                                     int[] labelsShape)
        Validate DataSet objects - and delete any invalid DataSets - that have been previously saved to the specified directory on HDFS by attempting to load them and checking their contents. Assumes DataSets were saved using DataSet.save(OutputStream).
        This method (optionally) additionally validates the arrays using the specified shapes for the features and labels. Note: this method will also consider all files in subdirectories (i.e., is recursive).
        Parameters:
        sc - Spark context
        path - HDFS path of the directory containing the saved DataSet objects
        featuresShape - May be null. If non-null: feature arrays must match the specified shape, for all values with shape > 0. For example, if featuresShape = {-1,10} then the features must be rank 2, can have any size for the first dimension, but must have size 10 for the second dimension.
        labelsShape - As per featuresShape, but for the labels instead
        Returns:
        Results of the validation

                                                   boolean deleteInvalid,
                                                   int[] featuresShape,
                                                   int[] labelsShape)

      • validateMultiDataSets

        public static ValidationResult validateMultiDataSets(org.apache.spark.api.java.JavaSparkContext sc,
                                                     java.lang.String path)
        Validate MultiDataSet objects saved to the specified directory on HDFS by attempting to load them and checking their contents. Assumes MultiDataSets were saved using MultiDataSet.save(OutputStream).
        Note: this method will also consider all files in subdirectories (i.e., is recursive).
        Parameters:
        sc - Spark context
        path - HDFS path of the directory containing the saved DataSet objects
        Returns:
        Results of the validation

      • validateMultiDataSets

        public static ValidationResult validateMultiDataSets(org.apache.spark.api.java.JavaSparkContext sc,
                                                     java.lang.String path,
                                                     int numFeatureArrays,
                                                     int numLabelArrays)
        Validate MultiDataSet objects saved to the specified directory on HDFS by attempting to load them and checking their contents. Assumes MultiDataSets were saved using MultiDataSet.save(OutputStream).
        This method additionally validates that the expected number of feature/labels arrays are present in all MultiDataSet objects
        Note: this method will also consider all files in subdirectories (i.e., is recursive).
        Parameters:
        sc - Spark context
        path - HDFS path of the directory containing the saved DataSet objects
        numFeatureArrays - Number of feature arrays that are expected for the MultiDataSet (set -1 to not check)
        numLabelArrays - Number of labels arrays that are expected for the MultiDataSet (set -1 to not check)
        Returns:
        Results of the validation

      • validateMultiDataSets

        public static ValidationResult validateMultiDataSets(org.apache.spark.api.java.JavaSparkContext sc,
                                                     java.lang.String path,
                                                     java.util.List<int[]> featuresShape,
                                                     java.util.List<int[]> labelsShape)
        Validate MultiDataSet objects saved to the specified directory on HDFS by attempting to load them and checking their contents. Assumes MultiDataSets were saved using MultiDataSet.save(OutputStream).
        This method (optionally) additionally validates the arrays using the specified shapes for the features and labels. Note: this method will also consider all files in subdirectories (i.e., is recursive).
        Parameters:
        sc - Spark context
        path - HDFS path of the directory containing the saved DataSet objects
        featuresShape - May be null. If non-null: feature arrays must match the specified shapes, for all values with shape > 0. For example, if featuresShape = {{-1,10}} then there must be 1 features array, features array 0 must be rank 2, can have any size for the first dimension, but must have size 10 for the second dimension.
        labelsShape - As per featuresShape, but for the labels instead
        Returns:
        Results of the validation

      • deleteInvalidMultiDataSets

        public static ValidationResult deleteInvalidMultiDataSets(org.apache.spark.api.java.JavaSparkContext sc,
                                                          java.lang.String path)
        Validate MultiDataSet objects - and delete any invalid MultiDataSets - that have been previously saved to the specified directory on HDFS by attempting to load them and checking their contents. Assumes MultiDataSets were saved using MultiDataSet.save(OutputStream).
        Note: this method will also consider all files in subdirectories (i.e., is recursive).
        Parameters:
        sc - Spark context
        path - HDFS path of the directory containing the saved DataSet objects
        Returns:
        Results of the validation/deletion

      • deleteInvalidMultiDataSets

        public static ValidationResult deleteInvalidMultiDataSets(org.apache.spark.api.java.JavaSparkContext sc,
                                                          java.lang.String path,
                                                          java.util.List<int[]> featuresShape,
                                                          java.util.List<int[]> labelsShape)
        Validate MultiDataSet objects - and delete any invalid MultiDataSets - that have been previously saved to the specified directory on HDFS by attempting to load them and checking their contents. Assumes MultiDataSets were saved using MultiDataSet.save(OutputStream).
        This method (optionally) additionally validates the arrays using the specified shapes for the features and labels, Note: this method will also consider all files in subdirectories (i.e., is recursive).
        Parameters:
        sc - Spark context
        path - HDFS path of the directory containing the saved DataSet objects
        featuresShape - May be null. If non-null: feature arrays must match the specified shapes, for all values with shape > 0. For example, if featuresShape = {{-1,10}} then there must be 1 features array, features array 0 must be rank 2, can have any size for the first dimension, but must have size 10 for the second dimension.
        labelsShape - As per featuresShape, but for the labels instead
        Returns:
        Results of the validation

      • deleteInvalidMultiDataSets

        public static ValidationResult deleteInvalidMultiDataSets(org.apache.spark.api.java.JavaSparkContext sc,
                                                          java.lang.String path,
                                                          int numFeatureArrays,
                                                          int numLabelArrays)
        Validate MultiDataSet objects - and delete any invalid MultiDataSets - that have been previously saved to the specified directory on HDFS by attempting to load them and checking their contents. Assumes MultiDataSets were saved using MultiDataSet.save(OutputStream).
        This method (optionally) additionally validates the arrays using the specified shapes for the features and labels. Note: this method will also consider all files in subdirectories (i.e., is recursive).
        Parameters:
        sc - Spark context
        path - HDFS path of the directory containing the saved DataSet objects
        numFeatureArrays - Number of feature arrays that are expected for the MultiDataSet (set -1 to not check)
        numLabelArrays - Number of labels arrays that are expected for the MultiDataSet (set -1 to not check)
        Returns:
        Results of the validation
